conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and needs to be predicted which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The liquids entering through baffles A, B, C, and D have specific colors and directions.
Each liquid will follow the path indicated by the arrow that starts at its entry point.
The colors match between the initial entry points (A, B, C, D) and the containers they will flow into (E, F, G).
Liquid from A flows horizontally initially but then angles downwards and ends up in container E.
Liquid from B flows straight down and ends up in container F.
Liquid from C flows straight down and ends up in container G.
Liquid from D flows straight down and ends up in container G.
In the first image, the initial arrangement of the liquids is visible.
In the second image, the liquids are seen flowing through the baffles and starting to enter the containers.
In the third image, the liquids are fully entering the containers as expected.
Final answer: Liquid from A will flow into container E, liquid from B will flow into container F, and liquids from C and D will both flow into container G.
